meanings.definition: To make Chinese in character or to bring under Chinese influence.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant sinicized its menu by adding traditional Chinese dishes.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the foreign community sinicized their celebrations to include Chinese customs.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to sinicize itself by wearing a tiny Chinese hat.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork sinicized the Western painting style with Chinese brush techniques.
meanings.sent5: The garden was sinicized with the addition of a beautiful Chinese pagoda.

meanings.definition: To adapt to Chinese customs or traditions.
meanings.sent1: She sinicized her wardrobe by wearing traditional Chinese clothing.
meanings.sent2: Many international students sinicized their eating habits by enjoying Chinese cuisine.
meanings.sent3: The cat attempted to sinicize by practicing tai chi in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His speech sinicized as he started using Chinese proverbs in his conversations.
meanings.sent5: The school curriculum was sinicized to include lessons on Chinese history and culture.
